headline: BofA sees limited upside on BorgWarner, Lear as it downgrades auto suppliers
summary: Investing.com --Bank of America cut its ratings on auto suppliers BorgWarner and Lear to Neutral, saying weak production trends and limited scope for valuation gains leave little room for the stocks to climb further.Analysts lowered the price target to $46 from $41 on BorgWarner. While new contract wins will aid growth, benefits will not materialize until 2027 or later.
